column4: can someone help me bringing an e-mu 1212m sound card to work?
it's listed in lspci, but not in /proc/asound/cards
according to the alsa project page, it is supported
does aplay-l show your card when typed in terminal
no
type these in a terminal one  at a time modprobe snd-emu10k1 ; modprobe snd-pcm-oss ; modprobe snd-mixer-oss ; modprobe snd-seq-oss
put sudo in front of each one
still the same
type sudo  modinfo snd-emu10k1
http://pastebin.com/d40360c43
type alsa force-reload then aplay -l again
still the same
btw, the output in 'lspci' is: 05:00.0 Multimedia audio controller: Creative Labs SB0400 Audigy2 Value
and asoundconf list does not show it?
no
it only shows the onboard card
the only thing i can think of is to upgrade alsa to the newest ver. and  see if it finds your crad. here is a link to do that if you need it http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=400268
ok, thanks, 'll try that! :)
when you get to this part in the how to sudo ./configure --with-kernel=/usr/src/linux-headers-$(uname -r) --with-cards=ice1724 --with-oss=yes. replace ice1724 with cards=all
nothing...
mb the card is broken in some strange way?
you can remove the card and reinstall it see if that does anything other than that i am out of ideas
ok
